abstract: Editorial asserts United States and its allies need to find better ways to persuade China to change policies that are both battering the global economy and damaging its own development; argues that a more expensive renminbi is part of the answer for China and its trading partners.
snippet: The United States and its allies need to find better ways to persuade China to change policies that are both battering the global economy and damaging its own future.
lead_paragraph: The United States and its allies need to find better ways to persuade China to change policies that are both battering the global economy and damaging its own future.
